Understanding Query Operators

When you create a query, a number of different operators are available, depending upon the field. For reference, consult the following list:

Text operators used on text fields

Equals

Is Not

Contains (ignore case)

Contains (match case)

Starts with (ignore case)

Starts with (match case)

Ends with (ignore case)

Ends with (match case)

Relational operators used on Boolean, enumerated type, and numeric fields

Less Than

Same or Less

Equals

Same or Greater

Greater Than

Is Not

Date/time operators used on date/time fields

Before

On or Before

On

On or After

After

Not On

Before Date

On or Before Date

On Date

On or After Date

After Date

Last (?) Days

Last (?) Weeks

Older Than (?) Days

Older Than (?) Weeks

Notes:

  • Before, On or Before, On, On or After, After, and Not On operators compare both the date and the time parts of date/time fields. Before Date, On or Before Date, On or After Date, and After Date operators compare only the date part of date/time fields.

  • Last (?) Days and Last (?) Weeks operators match all dates, starting with the date the specified number of days or weeks ago. Older Than (?) Days and Older Than (?) Weeks operators match all the dates prior to and including the date the specified number of days or weeks ago.

  • In date fields, StarTeam treats blanks as zeroes; therefore, no date is less than any specific date.
